title: Reimagined Hub
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:black-highlighter-theme]]

[[include :scp-wiki:component:betterfootnotes]]
[[module css]]
#page-title {
    display: none;
}
table { width: 100%; }

td { height: 1.5rem; }

#toc-action-bar,#toc .title { visibility:hidden; height: 0;}

.collapsible-block-link {
    text-align: center;
    display: block;
    font-weight: bold;
    font-size: large;
}

.peppo-toc {
    position:relative;
    z-index:01;
    background: #dfdfdf;
    padding: 5px;
    float:right;
    width: 30%;
}

@media only screen and (max-width: 600px) {
     .peppo-toc {
        float:none;
        width: 100%;
    }
}
[[/module]]

[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]

[[div class="peppo-toc"]]
[[collapsible show="► Table of Contents" hide="▲ Table of Contents"]]
[[toc]]
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]

[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/reimagined-hub/Title.png]]

> [[size 160%]]re·im·ag·ine[[/size]]
> //verb//
> past tense: reimagined; past participle: reimagined
> reinterpret (an event, work of art, etc.) imaginatively; rethink.

@@ @@
= On February 14, 2010, a new, very special tale came out, it was [[[Revised Entry]]]. This tale was the [[[SCP-173]]] we all know and love, but longer and... different. The idea of the tale was to make another version of 173. And you know what? People loved it!
= This tale came out more than 10 years ago, and now, authors of today are still making this type of "//Reimagining//" to those old articles. There are so many articles that a Hub for them is now possible! Isn't that neat?
@@ @@

[[include component:image-block name= https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/reimagined-hub/Reimagined.png|caption=Reimagined Hub Logo]]

**What is a reimagined article:** To put it simply, it's a remake of another work from the wiki. You liked the idea of an article, but what if something went differently? What if the anomaly now works differently? What if it's the same properties but a different anomaly?  It's like a tribute-rewrite that won't replace the original article.
Check the multiple definitions of reimagination below for more info.

**What isn't a reimagined article:** 
* Inspiration of another SCP is not necessarily a reimagination of it, it has to be somehow obvious what article it remakes. Using the same "character" from the original article without evident change isn't enough either.
* Reimagined only applies to articles, so reimagination of characters or SCP lore without a proper "original article" does not belong in this Hub. (and no, an author page doesn't count as an original article)
* Articles that change only a little part of the original article are not to be considered reimagined[[footnote]] Example: [[[SCP-4000]]] does not reimagine [[[scp-001-o5| Bright's Proposal]]] as this only reimagine a little part of the whole article.[[/footnote]]. Conversely, an article that modifies a large part of the original article but is only a small section in the reinvented article can be considered reimagined to a certain level. 
* A reimagined article that belongs in the "Sequel-Esque" section and is made by the same author as the original is not to be considered reimagined, since it would be considered a direct sequel/prequel.
* A reimagined article — especially SCP — is not an excuse for any behaviour of "I can do this better". The point of reimagining an article is not to do better than the original, it's to remake it your own way. 

@@ @@
@@ @@

------
[[=]]
+++ Remakes Articles

[[=]]
+++ Sequel-esque Articles
[[/=]]
//__Definition:__// Same article, but with something more. For example: the Foundation documents something new in the anomalous properties, the article is now changed by the setting of a Canon or the anomaly information is changed by the group of interests format. Prequels and such also work on this category.

||~ Reimagined article||~ Original article||

@@ @@
+++ How to contribute

Do you have an article in mind that might fit there? Good! You can add them yourself, it's a collaborative page. Please follow this order and make sure the article is in the right section and category when adding something.

[[collapsible show="▶ Show guide" hide="▲ Hide Guide"]]

All articles are in numerical order to __the original__ (so SCP-001 to SCP-9999). Tales and GoI are added under the SCPs of the category, in no particular order.

------

**__For SCPs:__**

[[code]]
||[[[SCP-???]]] _
 by [[*user author here]]||[[[SCP-???]]] _
 by [[*user Og author here]]||
[[/code]]

Example:

[[code]]
||[[[SCP-1465]]] _
 by [[*user Djoric]]||[[[SCP-105]]] _
 by [[*user thedeadlymoose]] and [[*user DrClef]]||
[[/code]]

Will do something like this:

||[[[SCP-1465]]] _
 by [[*user Djoric]]||[[[SCP-105]]] _
 by [[*user thedeadlymoose]] and [[*user DrClef]]||

------

**__For Tales/GoI Formats__**

[[code]]
||[[[article-URL|Article Name]]] _
 by [[*user Authorhere]]||[[[article-URL|Article Name]]] _
 by [[*user Authorhere]]||
[[/code]]

For example:

[[code]]
||[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/end-of-deaf|End Of Deaf]]] _
 by [[*user LordStonefish]]||[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/in-the-clutches-of-life|In The Clutches Of Life]]] _
 by [[*user Captain Kirby]]||
[[/code]]

Will do something like this:

||[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/end-of-deaf|End Of Deaf]]] _
 by [[*user LordStonefish]]||[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/in-the-clutches-of-life|In The Clutches Of Life]]] _
 by [[*user Captain Kirby]]||

------

**__For Internationals articles__**

[[code]]
||[[[article-URL|Article Name]]] _
 by [[*user author here]] (INT)||[[[article-URL|Article Name]]] _
 by [[*user Og author here]] (INT)||
[[/code]]

For example:

[[code]]
||[http://scp-int.wikidot.com/skp-136 SKP-136] _
 by [[*user Doktor Cyberion]] (INT)||[http://scp-int.wikidot.com/scp-136-de SCP-136-DE] _
 by [[*user Doktor Cyberion]] (INT)||
[[/code]]

Will do something like this:

||[http://scp-int.wikidot.com/skp-136 SKP-136] _
 by [[*user Doktor Cyberion]] (INT)||[http://scp-int.wikidot.com/scp-136-de SCP-136-DE] _
 by [[*user Doktor Cyberion]] (INT)||

------

**__For other type__**

If you have something that would fit under the "other" category, ask in the comment section of the Hub. The same goes if you have any questions concerning the addition of a certain article.
[[/collapsible]]
